'''Poldor''' was a [[Númenórean]] [[Men|man]] according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Lost Road]]''. 

He was a peer of [[Herendil]], who complained to his father [[Elendil]] that Poldor had called him ''[[Eärendil|Eärendel]]'' the previous day by way of scorn or mockery.<ref name=P1>{{LR|P1III2}}, p. 70, note 5</ref> However, in the lastest draft, Poldor was omitted, and replaced by Herendil's numerous anonymous peers, with Herendil telling his father that his peers called him names such as ''Terendul'' (meaning "slender and dark") and accusing him of being a "half-Noldo."<ref>{{LR|P1III2}}, pp. 59-60</ref>

==Etymology==
''Poldor'' appears to be a [[Quenya]] name, derived from ''pol'' in ''polda'' ("strong, burly").<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, entry "POL-, POLOD-"</ref>
